content.description: Bouldery start gives way to more moderate climbing above.
content.location: Third of three routes located on short wall just right and up hill from Buzzworm.

content.description: Scramble up to make clip at first bolt.  Consistent crimps with occasional pockets. Great fun.
content.location: First route right of Ain't No Mercy

content.description: An interesting and decidedly left armed pumpy climb.  Heads up the left arching layback via strenuous and fun climbing, with adequate but sometimes wish they were better feet.  An interesting transition to the face leads to a short section of pocket pulling before the anchors.
content.location: Located 15 yards or so right of Purple Galaxy, an obvious bolted left facing left arching bolted layback flake.  Several bolted face lines are immediately right (12a,project?,12a).

content.description: Purple Galaxy busts some bouldery initial climbing up to and past the first bolt, followed by some great sequential pocket pulling. It slowly eases off as you approach the 1st set of chains. Keep going though! The upper bulge adds a nice little punch to the end of the route, with some pumpy climbing and some last minute decision making. For those who track the numbers, probably soft at 12a to the 1st set of anchors, but solid if you take the full ride.
content.protection: 8 bolts to 1st anchor and 4 more to final anchor, so 13-14 bolts + anchor for the full pitch.  Over 25m to top anchor!  So 60m rope or mid anchor pit stop needed.
content.location: This is the first long route (over 4-5 bolts) on the wall, located on a nice purple section of the wall, just before and to the right of a low prow / arete feature.  If you see a boltrd left facing dihedral, you've just passed it.

content.description:
Sketchy flakes off the ground lead to great crimps, juggy slab, deep pockets, a mono, and a you get to turn a roof before it’s all over.  With mostly good rock quality with this is a good warm up for the Achin’ wall or another good 11 in this zone.

A note on bolting - no runouts on this one, at least one long draw is nessary under the roof to relieve drag.
content.protection: A bunch of bolts more than you might expect. 3 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: Parts and Labor is located in the Purple Galaxy sector of Sinks Main Wall.  It is left of Grabbing Greta, 2 climbs right of the prow route Waiting on a Friend.  It starts up some big juggy flakes trending right over low angle terrain to a small roof.

content.description: Technical climb by Crowheart and Brushfire.
content.location: Technical climb by Crowheart and Brushfire.

content.description: Climb up decent holds for the first few bolts to an OK shake. The crux comes quickly after when you clip the bolt to the left of the roof. Make some moves off small, but incut crimps for a few bolts until you gain a good pocket to clip from. Then enjoy easier climbing up good pockets to the chains. Not a bad route, it will get better once it cleans up a bit more.
content.location: 2 to the left of purple galaxy. It is the bolt line directly left of the mini roof

content.description: Finding the good stem off the flake to the left makes this one moderate.
content.location: First of three routes located on short wall just right and up hill from  Buzzworm.

content.description: Awesome climbing on limestone that hasn't been polished yet. A low crux with three fairly tricky spots.
content.location: Start right of Waiting for a Friend in a left-facing corner.

content.description:
Ben brought this motherfucker back from the dead!  A Heidi Badaracco vision, then finished by Grif.

It was a dusty relic but now its a classic.  Sustained crimping, good pockets at the right places, bitching sequences, some sting in the tail.

Purple Galaxy good.
content.protection: Roughly a bakers dozen snapdragons to lower offs
content.location: First route to the right of Purple Galaxy.

content.description: Pumpy lower section leads to strong pulls around bolt #3. Up on good pockets and edges to easier climbing (on smaller holds) to the top. Good route reading and lateral movement makes it easier.
content.location: 15 feet right of Cold Moon--right in front of charred black juniper.

content.description: Climb right side of flake then follow flake system up to bulge and then to the anchor. Tricky climbing between 2-3 and then through bulge above flake system.
content.location: Just right of Sweet Beguilin' --also first route left of South Paw

content.description: A nice technical face climb on small edges and good pockets. Start by crimping up the first 2 bolts to a big pocket, grab some very small crimps to reach a nice 2 finger pocket. From here work through another small crimp sequence to bigger holds leading to the top
content.protection: 6 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with mussy hooks
content.location: Located on the clean face to the right of the crack of "Southpaw". Crowheart is the middle route of the three on this pannel

content.description: This routes offers a slow burn to a tricky pump in the upper section. Crimpy holds in the low section lead to a balancy clip at an under cling. Move up on pockets and crimps to a steep pocketed finish.
content.location: Three routes to the right of Purple Galaxy. Second route to the left of burnt dead juniper tree.

content.description: In front of the burned tree.  Severe technical climb.  Probably damaged from the fire, both the route and the hardware.  Reference point.
content.location: Just to the left of Monkey in the Whitehouse.  Dead tree below the climb.

content.description: Climbs arete to steep finish on good pockets. A fun little route.
content.location: Arete 35' right of South Paw. Just right and up hill from Bush Fire.

content.description: Side pulls and crimps keep it interesting.
content.location: Second of three routes located just right and uphill of the Buzzworm arete.

content.description: A nice climb up a blank looking panel of stone. The climbing consists of small crimps and a mono getting to the second bolt (easier to start out right on mono), then larger crimps and pockets as the wall steepens, however, terrible footholds. The last few bolts are easy jug hauling. Overall, a worthy climb if in the area
content.location: Just left of the short 9+ arete on the right side of the Purple Galaxy Wall. Right line on the blank looking panel of rock.  Shares anchor with Crowheart.

content.description: Bouldery start to strong pulls for the first 3-4 bolts gives way to interesting climbing for a few more bolts before entering left facing corner. Up through the corner to steep headwall on solid pockets. Save enough gas for the steep climbing through the roof to the anchor. Crux is definitely the bottom.
content.protection: Lots of bolts (14-16) plus the anchor
content.location: Two routes (15' or so) to the right of Grabbing for Greta--one to the right of Gongoozled

content.description: Starts in seam 35' Left (3rd climb to the left) of South Paw. Tricky climbing leads to steep bulge and then good pockets above.
content.location: 3rd route left of South Paw

content.description: Tech water streak.  Grey and white.
content.location: Just to the left of Ain't No Mercy.
